name: The East African Experience 2025
description:
An annual vibrant cultural festival celebrating the rich heritage and diversity of East African communities in Toronto. Presented by Gisha Nankunda Arts Association (GNNA), in collaboration with Helping Neighbourhoods Implement Change (HNIC) and Elinan Kreations. 

Featuring traditional East African cuisine, music and dance performances, cultural exhibits and workshops, a market showcasing local artisans and vendors, children's activities and entertainment.

name: Toronto Waterfront Festival
description:
Sail Tall Toronto! 
The Tall Ships return for the Waterfront Festival. Tour four historic vessels, sail on Empire Sandy, enjoy live entertainment, local food, and nautical family fun.

name: The Liberty Laughs Comedy Show
description:
Your favourite Bodega Comedy Show is back! Come watch Canada's best comics bring the funny inside a unique venue tucked away in the heart of Toronto's Liberty Village!

Featuring Dan James, Shanil Patel, Dair Shendale, Jordan Hanoun, Chris Gerrasimou, Renee Groux, with headliner Liam Andres.

name: Tallulah's Pride Party - Friday
description: Calling all queers! The best party on the block takes over the whole building for Queer Pride. Catch Toronto’s top drag and burlesque acts in a super-charged show, and stay late dancing to the hottest tracks with our guest DJs.

name: Around the Whorl and Mary, Marry Merry Go Round Dance Performance
description:
Around the Whorl is a gritty, poetic unraveling of love,  danced in real time by a fearless ensemble including Harrison Argatoff, Adrian Chuquipiondo, Kunji Ikeda, Samantha Johnston, Mika Lior, Suzanne Liska, Kathleen Rea directed by Kathleen Rea.

Mary, Marry Merry Go Round features two women dancing through the high energy, joys, and tribulations of complex lives. This is a new dance-work co-created and danced by Nancy Christie, directed by Kathleen Rea and dramaturgy work by Tristan R. Whiston, that explores the repeating circle of loss and love in the lives of women as mothers and caregivers and care receivers who are more than the sum of all these roles. It is a piece about aging and being ageless.

name: Community Environment Day at R.H. King Academy
description:
Join Councillor Kandavel (Ward 20) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Spring Into Spice Cultural Food and Wine Festival 2025
description:
Join us for incredible food, wine, music, and a ton more! 

Bringing in together 45 cultural food vendors, wineries and wine importers together in an open-air environment.

While the DJ plays, you’ll get a chance to walk around and munch on tasty cuisines such as Caribbean, African, Indian, Thai, Latin American and so much more. At the same time, venture over to a wine tent to try various wines with your foods. You’ll have countless pairings at your fingertips using your food and wine sample tickets.

name: EVERLASTINGNESS - Micah Schroeder, Stéphane Mayer and Brenna Hardy-Kavanagh
description: Baritone Micah Schroeder and pianist Stéphane Mayer present a powerful recital exploring identity, memory, and displacement, joined by violist Brenna Hardy-Kavanagh. Featuring works by composers from Canada, Armenia, and beyond, including Everlastingness by Mary Kouyoumdjian, this intimate program weaves together personal and cultural histories through music.

name: Terra Pulse - The Greenheart Collective (Workshop 1)
description:
The launch of a 7-workshop cultural community arts program rooted in Jane and Finch. The program explores community storytelling, eco-arts, and cultural expression through accessible, free workshops held across the neighbourhood.

This first workshop, Seeing Us: The Community as Visual Muse, invites community members to reflect on identity, place, and belonging through painting, collage, and mixed-media visual storytelling.
Led by artists and facilitators from the community, participants will co-create visual works that express lived experience and community dreams.

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot SPARK Project.
